title: If my GPA dropped due to illness that required hospitalization, should I write about it in the common app essay? Instead, should I write the common app essay about something else and talk about the illness in the additional info section? - Quora

response.answer_text: You should mention it in the Additional Info section. However, you need to have a Long discussion with your high school guidance counselor. The counselor is expected to submit a cover letter of recommendation to the colleges along with your official transcript. That letter is supposed to discuss you over a several year period as both a student and as a whole Person. That is a perfect place for the Guidance Counselor to mention your extended illness and its effect on you and your grades. That is the substantiation you need. Good luck.

In the main essay, you should be talking about what you learned, how you became who you are—and if illness is part of that journey, you an write about it, but only as a means to an end—who are you now? If it’s not part of an overarching story about your life, then no. The additional info section is where you explain anything that needs explaining. So yeah, you can explain there.
